main event: On 22 October 1951, radar operators in North Truro, Massachusetts, observed an unidentified object on their radar scopes.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 4 minutes,The radar indicated an object moving at an extraordinary speed of 2400 knots,Weather conditions were clear with visibility at 15 miles and a temperature of 42Â°F, There is speculation that the object could have been a meteor due to the radar return characteristics,Radar operators concluded the data was insufficient for a meaningful evaluation.
witness description: radar operators at the radar station
